---
title: "LaTeX Macros for STAT-101"
format: html
---

```{=latex}
% Operators
\newcommand{\E}[1]{\mathbb{E}\left[#1\right]}
\newcommand{\Var}[1]{\text{Var}\left(#1\right)}
\newcommand{\Cov}[2]{\text{Cov}\left(#1, #2\right)}
\newcommand{\Corr}[2]{\text{Corr}\left(#1, #2\right)}
\newcommand{\SD}[1]{\text{SD}\left(#1\right)}

% Probability
\newcommand{\Prob}[1]{\text{P}\left(#1\right)}
\newcommand{\given}{\,|\,}

% Distributions
\newcommand{\Normal}[2]{\mathcal{N}\left(#1, #2\right)}
\newcommand{\Binom}[2]{\text{Binomial}\left(#1, #2\right)}
\newcommand{\Uniform}[2]{\mathcal{U}\left(#1, #2\right)}
\newcommand{\tdist}[1]{t_{#1}}
\newcommand{\chisq}[1]{\chi^2_{#1}}

% Statistics (sample vs population)
\newcommand{\xbar}{\bar{x}}
\newcommand{\ybar}{\bar{y}}
\newcommand{\phat}{\hat{p}}
\newcommand{\betahat}{\hat{\beta}}

% Hypothesis testing
\newcommand{\Ho}{H_0}
\newcommand{\Ha}{H_a}
\newcommand{\pvalue}{\text{p-value}}

% Matrices
\newcommand{\mat}[1]{\mathbf{#1}}
\newcommand{\vect}[1]{\boldsymbol{#1}}

% Common symbols
\newcommand{\iid}{\stackrel{\text{iid}}{\sim}}
\newcommand{\indep}{\perp\!\!\!\perp}
```

These macros are used throughout the course to maintain consistent notation.

## Examples

- Expected value: $\E{X}$
- Variance: $\Var{X}$
- Normal distribution: $X \sim \Normal{\mu}{\sigma^2}$
- Sample mean: $\xbar$
- Probability: $\Prob{A \given B}$
- Null hypothesis: $\Ho$
